events.message: The claimant reported an auto accident involving a collision with a stationary vehicle on Main Street at 8:45 AM.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and identifying keywords related to a vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to the case to assist the claimant with the accident claim process.
The claimant received official acknowledgement from the insurer that their auto accident claim was received and is being processed.
The agent requested a copy of the police report, photographs of the vehicle damages, and a repair estimate to proceed with the claim.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including the police report and repair estimate for the damaged car.
Investigation into the circumstances of the auto accident began, with an adjuster reviewing the submitted evidence.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and damages are covered under the policy terms.
A settlement proposal was sent to the claimant outlining the reimbursement amount for the vehicle repairs.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the timely processing and clear communication regarding the settlement proposal.
The claim was officially approved after the claimant accepted the terms of the settlement offer.
The insurance company issued payment to cover the cost of vehicle repairs as per the approved claim settlement.
The claim was formally closed following confirmation that the settlement payment was received and repairs completed.
All case files and documentation were archived as per company policy to maintain records of the auto accident claim.
